About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

Software Engineering Graduate student at San Jose State University, specializing in Distributed Systems and Applications development. Having 5+ years of experience in Web and Desktop applications development, gives me a strong understanding of wide software domains and organizational skills. During my professional career, I led different technical and non-technical initiatives and interacted and gelled well with clients and stakeholders. I am an efficient learner and a responsible individual, who enjoy challenging work environment and always try to deliver the best.

San Jose State University

Student

Dassault Systemes

Senior Full Stack Developer

Work & Duties

• Followed Agile & delivered an array of enterprise class Web/Desktop solutions, primarily using: Java, .NET, C#, React, Node.
• Identify & address performance bottlenecks, Code reviews, code/design reusability & optimization, Pair programming.
• Migrated XAML oriented Silverlight web application to Single Page, high performing React JS application.
• Developed a suite of cloud hosted microservices using Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, enhancing traffic scale by x10.
• Led the initiative to replace TCL-based legacy system with .Net architecture and enhanced performance by 95%.
• Automated the TFS build process (CI/CD) & created Beta, Release Candidate, patches and hotfix, applying build toolkit.

Atos Syntel

Software Engineer

Work & Duties

• Designed, developed, tested, troubleshooted and debugged .Net, Java and RDBMS oriented Desktop & Web applications.
• Extensively programmed stored procedures, functions, SSIS packages & all required database objects in SQL environment.
• Reduced users’ effort by 99% by replacing Humana reports reconciliation manual process, with a Windows-RDBMS app.
